comments.text: Fun fact: Only 40% of a chicken nugget is made of chicken.﻿
comments.author: Hiccup

comments.text:
+Hiccup fun fact: This is a misconception from an aweful deceptive study. 
The stuy had a whooping sample size of... hold on to your chairs... two 
chicken mcnuggets.

Furthermore, the study didn't conclude that only 40% are chicken, but only 
40% are meat, and, by meat they only meant muscle tissue and excluded fatty 
tissue, blood vessels, and nerves. And 40% is even the "worse" of the two 
samples, the other had 50%muscle tissue. All that, together with bone(which 
btw is not unhealthy) results in a nugget that is pretty much 100% chicken, 
excluding the crust(which is bread). Chemical preservatives are also in 
there but make up a tiny fraction of the actual nugget.

Chicken McNuggets might not be the healthiest food due to the way they are 
coated in bread and fried in oil, but they are not as bad as people like to 
believe. McDonalds actually has pretty decent quality standards, they have 
to as a company of that scale. They use a lot of offal from chicken 
production, but that isn't really a bad thing. Many parts of the chicken 
aren't popular despite not being unhealthy, so when you mash them into one 
thing and people enjoy it, it's actually a good way of using resources more 
efficiently.

is a lot cheaper. It's called 'customer service'.

box, a 9 box, a 6 box and two 4 boxes - which is cheaper than what you 
suggested.﻿
